Issues.Body:
fixes

```diff
- E:\winforms\.dotnet\sdk\3.0.100-preview4-010924\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk\targets\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.targets(115,5): error NETSDK1085: The 'NoBuild' property was set to true but the 'Build' targetcrosoft.NET.Sdk.targets(115,5): error NETSDK1085: The 'NoBuild' property was set to true but the 'Build' target was invoked. [E:\winforms\pkg\Microsoft.Private.Winforms.csproj]
```

Issues.Title: Fix GetThemeMargins p/invoke signature
Issues.Body:
According to the MS docs, the parameter `LPCRECT prc` is missing:
```c
THEMEAPI GetThemeMargins(
  HTHEME  hTheme,
  HDC     hdc,
  int     iPartId,
  int     iStateId,
  int     iPropId,
  LPCRECT prc,
  MARGINS *pMargins
);
```

This PR adds this missing parameter.

Fixes #526
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix GetThemeMargins p/invoke signature" (#614)

Issues.Title: Add Ctrl+Backspace handler with text selection logic
Issues.Body:
Add Ctrl+Backspace, "delete previous word," keyboard shortcut to all text edit controls. Previously, this was only available in single-line TextBoxes with autocomplete enabled, due to weird native autocomplete handling.

Rationale in #259. I attempted this previously with messaging to simulate the equivalent Ctrl+Shift+Left and Backspace key presses (#260), but that approach was tenuous at best.

Instead, this change adds logic used by TextBoxBase and ComboBox to determine what the "previous word" is and then delete it. The behavior is not 100% consistent with the [native SHAutoComplete behavior](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/?p=24823), but it's close.

The logic at a high level is:

1. Select any run of non-word characters before of the cursor
2. Select any run of word characters before of the cursor
3. If the selection now includes the second character in the input, and the first character is a non-word character, select the first character
4. Delete the selection

- If the character initially before the cursor is a word character, then we start at step 2.

For determining a word character, I'm using Unicode character classes equivalent to the `\w` regex class but with `UnicodeCategory.ConnectorPunctuation` excluded. This is similar to the SHAutoComplete behavior as it does not consider underscores to be word characters. Surrogate pair characters are always included in the current selection rather than trying to wrestle with UTF-16, which from my testing also seems similar to the old native behavior.

The performance when processing huge runs of characters, or when repeatedly invoked by holding down the keys, seems as good as or better than the old SHAutoComplete. Also, the usage of `BeginUpdateInternal()` and `EndUpdateInternal()` avoids showing a transient selection, which the old native behavior would sometimes do.

Fixes #259
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add Ctrl+Backspace handler with text selection logic" (#629)

Issues.Title: Build fails due to missing RoslynTools.MSBuild 16.0.0-alpha
Issues.Body:
I wasn't sure whether this issue belongs here or in [dotnet/arcade](https://github.com/dotnet/arcade). Please feel free to move it.

Steps to reproduce: Clone repository, run build.cmd.

Results:

```
dotnet-install: Downloading link: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/3.0.100-preview3-010436/dotnet-sdk-3.0.100-preview3-010436-win-x64.zip
dotnet-install: Extracting zip from https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/3.0.100-preview3-010436/dotnet-sdk-3.0.100-preview3-010436-win-x64.zip
dotnet-install: Adding to current process PATH: "C:\Users\user\source\repos\winforms\.dotnet\". Note: This change will not be visible if PowerShell was run as a child process.
dotnet-install: Installation finished
Downloading vswhere
Downloading RoslynTools.MSBuild 16.0.0-alpha
No package matching package identifier RoslynTools.MSBuild and version 16.0.0-alpha was found in the given feed.
```

Version 16.0.0-alpha of the package indeed [does not appear to exist](https://dotnet.myget.org/F/roslyn-tools/api/v2/package/RoslynTools.MSBuild/16.0.0-alpha), but [16.0.0-rc1-alpha does](https://dotnet.myget.org/feed/roslyn-tools/package/nuget/RoslynTools.MSBuild).

Additionally, running `build` a second time results in a different error:

```
Exception calling "Start" with "0" argument(s): "The system cannot find the file specified"
System.Management.Automation.MethodInvocationException: Exception calling "Start" with "0" argument(s): "The system cannot find the file specified" ---> System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The system cannot find the file specified
   at System.Diagnostics.Process.StartWithCreateProcess(ProcessStartInfo startInfo)
   at CallSite.Target(Closure , CallSite , Object )
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.Management.Automation.ExceptionHandlingOps.CheckActionPreference(FunctionContext funcContext, Exception exception)
   at System.Management.Automation.Interpreter.ActionCallInstruction`2.Run(InterpretedFrame frame)
   at System.Management.Automation.Interpreter.EnterTryCatchFinallyInstruction.Run(InterpretedFrame frame)
   at System.Management.Automation.Interpreter.EnterTryCatchFinallyInstruction.Run(InterpretedFrame frame)
at Exec-Process, C:\Users\user\source\repos\winforms\eng\common\tools.ps1: line 69
at MSBuild, C:\Users\user\source\repos\winforms\eng\common\tools.ps1: line 476
at InitializeToolset, C:\Users\user\source\repos\winforms\eng\common\tools.ps1: line 422
at Build, C:\Users\user\source\repos\winforms\eng\common\Build.ps1: line 76
at <ScriptBlock>, C:\Users\user\source\repos\winforms\eng\common\Build.ps1: line 125
at <ScriptBlock>, <No file>: line 1
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Build fails due to missing RoslynTools.MSBuild 16.0.0-alpha" (#628)

Issues.Body:

Unify 
 - `WINFORMS_NAMESPACE`, 
 - `WINFORMS_DESIGN_NAMESPACE` 
 - and `DRAWINGDESIGN_NAMESPACE` 

into `DRAWING_DESIGN_NAMESPACE`

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Control DataBindings do not update when using INotifyPropertyChanged." (#625)

Issues.Title: Remove CLSCompliant from all binaries in WinForms repo
Issues.Body:
As per feedback received from @sharwell in the refout PR, we should remove usage of CLSCompliant attribute from all binaries in WinForms repo. This concept is now obsolete and is not required anymore. Its drawback is that it slows the build.

However in order to remove it from WinForms repo, it needs to be removed from WindowsFormsIntegration first in DotNet-Trusted.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Remove CLSCompliant from all binaries in WinForms repo" (#621)

Issues.Title: System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException occurs on deserialize Calendar
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core 3.0 Preview 4
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**

System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException with Message=Type 'System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar' in Assembly 'System.Private.CoreLib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=7cec85d7bea7798e' is not marked as serializable.
ocurrs. Please find the attached sample to reproduce.
[DotNetCore3Calendar.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/2986949/DotNetCore3Calendar.zip)



**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException
  HResult=0x8013150C
  Message=Type 'System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar' in Assembly 'System.Private.CoreLib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=7cec85d7bea7798e' is not marked as serializable.
  Source=System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters

   at System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Binary.BinaryParser.ReadObjectWithMapTyped(BinaryHeaderEnum binaryHeaderEnum)

   at System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Binary.ObjectReader.Deserialize(BinaryParser serParser, Boolean fCheck)
   at System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Binary.BinaryFormatter.Deserialize(Stream serializationStream, Boolean check)
   at System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Binary.BinaryFormatter.Deserialize(Stream serializationStream)
   at System.Resources.ResourceReader.<>c__DisplayClass44_0`1.<CreateUntypedDelegate>b__0(Object obj, Stream stream)
   at System.Resources.ResourceReader.DeserializeObject(Int32 typeIndex)

   at WindowsFormsAppCalendar.Form1..ctor() in \.Net Core 3\Apps\DotNetCore3Calendar\WindowsFormsAppCalendar\Form1.cs:line 16
   at DotNetCore3Calendar.Program.Main() in \.Net Core 3\Apps\DotNetCore3Calendar\DotNetCore3Calendar\Program.cs:line 19

**Expected behavior:**

Run sample without exception.

**Minimal repro:**

* Unpack the attached sample. 
* Open the DotNetCore3Cal.sln solution in Visual Studio 2019
* Build and run the DotNetCore3Calendar.csproj project - exception raised

Note the WindowsFormsAppCalendar.csproj (.NET Framework 4.0 WinForms project) runs without exception.
